headline: GOP Leaders Slam Biden's 'War-Triggering' Language Toward Russia
author: Xander Landen
sentences: Senator Tom Cotton, a Republican from Arkansas, commented on Biden's speech on Fox News on Sunday, noting that the president "seemed to ad lib there" and said "something that Vladimir Putin will now use for his reasons to say 'see I told you all along that the United States and NATO wants to attack Russia, wants to topple our government.'"

When asked about Putin's remarks in Poland on Fox News, Representative Jim Jordan, a Republican from Ohio, said: "I think you could say here's a president potentially having more war-triggering type language than probably any president in American history.
